thread.title: Sindhu stuns Saina's nemesis
thread.title_full: Sindhu stuns Saina's nemesis - The Times of India

author: timesofindia.indiatimes.com
title: Sindhu stuns Saina's nemesis
text:
HYDERABAD: After the second-round exits of world No.1 Saina Nehwal and Kidambi Srikanth, PV Sindhu provided the much-needed relief, moving into the quarterfinals of the Denmark Open Superseries Premier event in Odense. 

Continuing her giant-killing spree, Sindhu, 20, outclassed world No.4 Tzu Ying Tai of Chinese Taipei 21-12, 21-15 in the pre-quarterfinals late on Thursday. Tai, who is the Hong Kong Open and World Superseries Finals champion, is one of the most reputed players on the circuit, notching wins over the world's best players. In recent times, she has de feated Saina thrice. 

But when the world No.13 is on song, she seldom cares for the reputation of a player and on Thursday, the lanky shuttler from Hyderabad steamrolled Tai in just 34 minutes. Tai hardly troubled Sindhu in the match. Using her smashes to great effect and moving well on the court, Sindhu broke free at 4-4 in the first game and never looked back. She continued in the same vein even in the second. 

Sindhu will now face former world champion Wang Yihan of China late on Friday. Incidentally, it was Sindhu who had dethroned World No.1 Yihan in 2013.She followed that victory by defeating several top stars. But is often criticised for not justifying her talent.
